title: Create manufacturing defect reporting application

requirements.text: Create a backend data model to store defect reports with fields: unique ID, product name, department (cutting/machining/assembly/painting/embossing), defect description text, optional photo reference, employee identifier, and timestamp

quotes: vsak zaposleni napiše ali slika če opazi napako na elementih
imamo veliko število različnih izdelkov in več oddelkov

acceptanceCriteria: Defect report records include all required fields
Department field supports exactly five departments: cutting, machining, assembly, painting, embossing
Timestamp is automatically captured on report creation

requirements.text: Implement backend endpoints to create new defect reports, retrieve all reports, and filter reports by department or product
acceptanceCriteria: Endpoint exists to submit a new defect report
Endpoint exists to fetch all defect reports
Filtering by department returns only matching reports
Filtering by product name returns only matching reports

requirements.text: Create a frontend form where employees can submit defect reports by entering product name, selecting department from a dropdown (cutting, machining, assembly, painting, embossing), entering defect description, and optionally uploading a photo

quotes: vsak zaposleni napiše ali slika če opazi napako
prikrojevalnica oddelek, strojna oddelek, montažni oddelek, lakirnica oddelek in emblirnica

acceptanceCriteria: Form includes product name input field
Dropdown lists all five departments
Text area accepts defect description
Photo upload field is present and optional
Form validates required fields before submission
Successful submission clears the form

requirements.text: Display a list view of all submitted defect reports showing product name, department, description, timestamp, and thumbnail of photo if present, with ability to filter by department
acceptanceCriteria: All defect reports are displayed in a list or table format
Each report shows product name, department, description, and timestamp
Photos are displayed as clickable thumbnails
Department filter updates the displayed list
Reports are sorted by timestamp (newest first)

requirements.text: Handle photo uploads by storing image data as static assets in frontend/public/assets/uploads and referencing the filename in the defect report record
acceptanceCriteria: Uploaded photos are stored as static assets
Defect report records reference the photo filename
Photos can be retrieved and displayed in the UI
System handles reports without photos gracefully

requirements.text: Design a clean, professional visual theme for a manufacturing environment with a cohesive color palette (avoiding blue and purple), clear typography for readability in factory settings, and intuitive layout emphasizing quick report submission and easy defect tracking
acceptanceCriteria: UI uses a consistent color scheme appropriate for manufacturing context
Typography is legible and professional
Layout prioritizes ease of use for quick defect reporting
Design is cohesive across all pages and components

constraints: Photo uploads must be handled as static assets in frontend/public/assets/uploads, not routed through backend
Department names must be fixed to the five provided: cutting, machining, assembly, painting, embossing
nonGoals: User authentication or role-based access control
Real-time notifications of new defect reports
